ratings.comment: At best she is passionate. But Gail spent more time talking boat her experiences and showing off her portfolio than teaching me anything. I learned no drawing techniques and honestly if you interpreted something differently or aren't a art person she can be downright mean. She is very knowledgeable and funny but not a good teacher.

She expects you to do the assignments the way she would do them. Had points docked a couple of times because she didn't agree with my interpretation of a character or spin on an assignment. She also spends way too much time talking about her own designs instead of teaching us to actually do design.
Passionate at worst, excellent at best.

Despite what others say, i thought she was fantastic! She knows everything there is to know about costume design and she's very helpful when you ask for it.  Her assignments are fun, interesting, and relevant.  The only reason she seems to pick "favorites" is because those are the ones that talk and participate.  If you want attention, then talk.

This woman has no business teaching students. She is a good designer, lousy professor. She's highly unorganized, sloppy, confused, plays favorites, and can be biased and downright mean at times. Truly, she belongs designing and not in academia.  I wouldn't

Good designer, bad teacher- She treats students like friends to try and validate herself.  That is, the students she likes, she ignores the others.  She is so disorganized and you can't get clear information from her when she is around, which is less often.  She should stick to being a designer and stop screwing up young people.

Gail needs to pick between designing shows out of state and teaching a serious theatre course.  Take this class only if you are ready to have a teacher that is almost never there, and doesn't give clear assignments or notes to study from.
